course.subject: COMP
course.name: Introduction to Computing with Excel VBA
course.description: This course is designed to equip students with the fundamental concepts of programming using the VBA programming language, within the context of the Microsoft Excel program. Students will first learn how to use Excel to analyze and present data, and will then learn how to use VBA code to build powerful programs.
course.exclusions: COMP 1002, COMP 1004 (prior to 2013-14), COMP 1021, COMP 1022P, COMP 2011, ISOM 3230

reviews.author: NONAMEGUY
reviews.title: Useful Course for business students
reviews.comment_content:
First few week= basic usage of the worksheet & the functions
Weeks after=VBA

I think it's very useful for business school student. I find the examples and lecture notes extremely helpful. The content before midterm is quite easy. As long as you listen,it will be fine.

I think it's not challenging for SENG freshmen, especially those who want to major in CS or CPEG, better choose the other 2.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think both lecturers are nice and patient. They try to teach in a fun way and always give fun examples. To compare, David asks more questions while Cecia explains the logic of the code more slowly(so sometimes David teaches faster and give harder examples).

For enrollment, maybe David's class's waitlist is longer and harder to get in. So you may choose Cecia's lecture, and go to whatever lecture you like.

I enjoyed the lectures. Better bring your laptop to class to try the new things.Oops, better charge your computer before class! Coz there are no sockets in the classroom.
reviews.comment_grading:
I kinda tested the boundary of A+???? hahaha!!
Little advice: Everybody knows it's easy and many many many students study this just for good grades. So be careful!!! There are many little traps in the midterm and final.

【2 grading scheme】
【1】20% midterm, 40%final, 40% assignment(5*8%)
【2】60%final, 40%assignment(if your final score is higher)
【BONUS】every correctly answered in-class-question gives you a 0.4% bonus.

Some statistics this sem:
1.assignments-mostly mean about 96.3-97.1
2.midterm-mean=73.5, sd=19.2
3.final-mean=67.0, sd=15.9
4.About 250 questions asked

Me:
assignment-495/500
midterm-90/100(not counted as my final is higher)
final-91/100
answered 2 questions

Overall:95.00%-A+

(little secret: David ask more questions, but it's random..If you wear bright color cloth...he may ask you more AHAHAHAH!! Cecia ask questions sometimes based on a volunteer basis, if you raise your hand, you get chance!! And I am in Cecia's class, but the questions answered at David's lectures still count! so don't worry.)
reviews.comment_workload:
Basically very light workload. Optional lecture+optional tutorial(5 graded must-hand-in assignments)+midterm+final.

There is no attendance-taking for lectures, and there will be lecture videos uploaded right before final period,  so it's good for those who don't want to go to lectures.

But if you go to lectures, the professor would pick some random people to answer questions and give bonus points (I looked through previous comments, maybe this is a new policy).

I recommend you to go to the tutorials even though many people find it easy to finish on their own. You can ask TA any questions, and it secure you a full score on assignments(even though you are dumb on VBA thing like me). And for example, this semester, the last tutorial's work is not a hand-in-assignment, but an important question in the final is related to that.

reviews.author: Annabelle He
reviews.comment_content: The contents are mainly very useful for business students to deal with statistics and other graphs in the future, but it may be a bit too easy for engineering students, especially for those who would like to take major in Computer Science and Engineering.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is really a wonderful instructor! He does an excellent job in activating the whole class and arousing your interest in programming. The examples and questions he made in class are simple but important. And the lab work/homework are all very interesting! For example, we are asked to program an AI mental counselor and a piano that we could actually play by using the mouse. It's great fun playing with your own program><
reviews.comment_grading: It is said that a very wide A range is provided, and the exams are generally very easy, so you have to be pretty careful in the exam in order to get good grades.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is small if you go to lab and follow the instructions. If you manage to solve the lab work and homework by your own, then you could even skip the labs.

reviews.author: Jricafort
reviews.title: best
reviews.comment_content: The content ranges from very easy to moderate, and although VBA isn't really a widely used programming language, the programming concepts are transferable. Could suggest to have more content.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr Rossiter is very active teacher and teaches effectively, through the use of simple language, demonstration, and humour.

Rossiter best teacher
reviews.comment_grading: A bit on the easy side (don't take it if you expect and want a challenge), so grading is somewhat lenient.
reviews.comment_workload: The three assignments will not take up much of your time (especially the first one). Very manageable, maybe below average.

reviews.author: Oscar Wong
reviews.title: Good course with good grading and useful content
reviews.comment_content: Content is about basic VBA programming.  It is very useful no matter what school you are in.  As a business school student, I find VBA useful and applicable in my internships.  Employers really care your computer skills and your way to handle data.  Strongly encourage students to take it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is a wonderful professor.  Although it is a 9:30 class for my section, I seldom miss it. He explains all the things in a clear way.  And he makes programming a funny way with his facial expressions and wordings.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 2 grading scheme.

20% mid term
40% lab
40% final

44% lab
56% final

Your final score will automatically use the one which gives you a higher score.  

Lab is easy.  Just attend all the lab sections then you can get almost 100%.  For mid term and final, this semester the final is difficult.  Gibson even said in the announcement that this is one of the most difficult finals throughout the years.  Not sure if he wants to make this a more difficult course or this year is just an exception.

Lab 100%
Mid term 81, mean 62.37, SD 24.22
Final 69, mean 48, SD 22

Final grade A-
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is low.  All you need to do is to submit the 5 labs.  The other labs you can choose to attend or not.  No presentation, no project.  Final and mid term are open book, so all you need to do is to understand the content and bring everything you need to the exams.  No need to waste time copying cheatsheets.

reviews.author: AKIRA
reviews.title: Narrow Grade Range - Don't take it if you are a programming rookie
reviews.comment_content:
Non-VBA Excel Functions (week 1-3)
Cell References, Operators (^ power, <> not equal to), Logic Functions (and, or, not),String Functions (Concatenation, LEN) IF, VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, LookUp Error

VBA (week 3-12)
Macro, VBA Event, InputBox & MsgBox
Cell References (Cells(Row, Column), ActiveCell - currently selected cell)
IF...Then, Else IF, COUNTIF
Types of Variable (Integer, Long, Single , Double, Boolean)
Loop (While...Wend; Do While...Loop; Do...Loop While, For Loops, (For...To...(Step)...Next),  For Each Loop (For Each...In...Next)
Specifying Input and Output Type, Random Numbers, RANDBETWEEN(a,b)
Local & Global Variables, Excel Objects (Range = cells, Shape), Excel Color (RGB), Doing VBA Events (.Rows.Count, .Value), Brackets for functions with input parameters and output, Private and Public Functions, GUI Control
Object-Oriented Programming (class, attributes, method)
Recursion

Lab 1: Stock Market Buying and Selling (Excel non-VBA, Excel Functions: AVERAGE, IF, FLOOR)
Lab 2: Moving Around Hong Kong (Excel Non-VBA & VBA, Excel Functions: IF, IFNA error checking,  VLOOKUP, Macro)
Lab 3: 'Escape the Monster' Game (Excel VBA)
(ActiveCell, IF, Cells (Row, Column), variables)
Lab 4: Eliza (Excel VBA)
InStr (Starting Position, From searching area, Target) for returning the position of the target (a number position)
Lab 5: Jigsaw Game (Excel VBA)
Nested loops, random numbers, strings
Lab 6: Music Keyboard (Excel VBA)
Mod - Remainder 7%5 =2, Mod = 2
Mid (from text, starting position, extracted length)
Lab 7: Shape Sculptures
Loops, RGB Color, Interpolations, GUI Control, Mod (Mod 2 = 0) - even numbers

Better to buy a course book to practice more examples on codes
(Excel and Excel VBA Programming for Beginners - by David Rossiter and Gibson Lam) from the bookstore
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Rossiter has a very interesting, intriguing teaching style, I have attended every lecture of him and I am really enjoy his teaching.
I think he is one of my favorite professor in HKUST over 4 years of study
Lecture videos are provided to every lecture and you can do a revision on it

Questions are asked to award the students who answer correctly and instantly on every lectures as their bonus marks  +0.4% marks per question adding up in your total score (sitting on the front and wearing a special color of cloths will help to raise your chances to answer questions)
reviews.comment_grading:
No attendance marks for lectures and labs, but I highly recommend you to go all for bonus marks in lectures, learning the principles and copying all the codes for the lab assignments

Total 7 lab sessions, only 2nd - 6th lab projects count the grades
5 Labs: 5 X 8% = 40%
1st and 7th Lab does not count but the 7th lab about Interpolation is extremely essential for final exam. You must go to the lab session to complete the codes and understand how it works.
The last lab is very difficult for programming rookie like me

Open Book Exams (Both Midterm & Final)
Midterm Exam: 1hr 10mins
Final Exam: 2hrs 10mins
Time is limited and harsh for rookies, please do the exams precisely with a good time management. Don't stick on the questions you don't know.
Read more codes and practice by using the Excel on hands (I got a loop question correct in the final exam, only because I had done a Excel additional practice - sourced from the course website)

If Midterm Result > Final Result
Midterm Exam: 20%
Final Exam: 40%

If Midterm Result < Final Result
Midterm Exam: 0%
Final Exam: 60%

My Case:
Lab: 500/500 = 40 (follow and copy every code given by the TA in lab session to make sure you don't have any mistakes)
Lab is important for rookies to save their grades
Midterm Exam:  56/100 (-0.83sd) (mean 72) (sd: 19.2) = 0%
Final Exam:  64/100 (-0.19sd) (mean 67) (sd: 15.9) = 64 * 60% = 38.4
Bonus mark (Answering questions in the lecture correctly and quickly): 1 question = 0.4
Total = 78.8 = Grade: B-
I only get -0.19sd in the final exam, it already grants me a B-
That's indicate you must get a mean to get a B

When you review on other comments about this course
Total: 77.2 = Grade B- (-0.3sd in final exam)
Total: 76.2 = Grade: C+ (-0.4sd in final exam)
The B-range and C-range are very narrow, the course is extremely competitive, only with total 80% secures you a B
Imagine how many programming experts in this class competing with you
Excel the course with your Logical Intelligence and Carefulness
If you have an unclear logic, you have no any programming background and you are a programming idiot like me, try your best to avoid COMP classes (you go to take other QR Common Core courses, go exchange to transfer credit, or take some distance learning courses)
If not, I will bless for you!
reviews.comment_workload:
As both Midterm and Final exams are open-book, it indicates the difficulties (that's means even you have all the notes, you may still not know how to do the exam!!!)

But printing all the notes and jotting down all the examples from the lectures are imperative, especially printing all the codes of every lab session (including the last lab!)

Also, do all and print all the Midterm Sample and Final Sample Papers! Make sure you 100% understand why the answers work in a logical way.
I studied a few full days for the final exam to get a better score, to cover my low scores for the midterm.
If I continued to get a -0.83sd in the final, I would be sure I would get a C or C-

Don't look down on the Basics of the course content (the loops, if functions), please have a 100% strong understanding and practice on the basics before moving forward to the advanced

All the teaching materials and examples in lectures, labs and sample papers are relatively easier, YET the EXAMS are totally on a different level!
Again, DON'T UNDERESTIMATE the difficulty of this course!
Programming rookies get a tough time to familiarize the programming language, styles and all the codes.
You will never do a better job as great as those CS majors, people who have studied ICT in DSE. Rookies are coming to put the mean down and favor the high-flyers

reviews.author: raphaelt
reviews.title: GPA Booster
reviews.comment_content:
Basic VBA Programming. Compared to other courses, it's an easy course. Suitable for all schools, but I'd suggest picking Python (COMP 1021) since most companies use it nowadays. The course is divided into two parts: basic Excel without any VBA (first 3 weeks, example: LOOKUP, MAX, SUM) and VBA (10 weeks, example: looping, arrays). For those of you who have prior programming knowledge, skipping classes is fine and you can just focus on the practice questions.

Note: Don't buy the book and just focus on the powerpoint slides and exercises
reviews.comment_teaching:
[LECTURE]
Gibson's teaching is clear and very engaging. But sometimes the pace is a little bit too fast so you may need to revise from the lecture videos.

[LABS]
TA's are generally helpful. Just follow their instructions and you will be guaranteed to get 100% marks.
reviews.comment_grading:
Definitely a GPA booster, especially if you have prior programming knowledge.

[SCHEME 1]
4 Lab Assignments [40%]: 100/100 (mean: around 98)
Midterm [20%] = 90/100 (mean: 62.37, sd: 24.22, maximum: 100, minimum: 8)
Final [40%] = 72/100 (mean: 48, sd: 22, maximum: 100, minimum: 2)
Additional Points [+2%] = 0/2 (didn't get it since I never came to the class and focused on other courses instead)
My Grade = A

[SCHEME 2]
4 Lab Assignments [44%]
Midterm [0%]
Final [56%]
Additional Points [+2%]

You can get additional points if you answer Gibson's questions in class. Just answer one and you will automatically get the additional 2%.

They will automatically assess every students' grades. If your final score is better than the midterm, you will be automatically switched to grading scheme 2.

A friend of mine scored 1 SD below mean in midterm and mean in the final. He got B in the end, so I'd say the grading is fair.

Be careful in the finals, Gibson said that the final in Spring 18/19 is the worst so far, so maybe it progressively gets harder over time.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload. You don't need to prepare anything for the labs since the TAs will teach step by step and allow questions.

As for the exams, you can bring your books / notes so you don't have to memorize the content. I myself just prepared a day before the exam by doing the practice questions. Focus on the logical thinking and A-range is secured.

reviews.comment_grading: As mentioned by the others, easy to get an A-Range, mean is B which is kind of impossible to get something lower than B- if you follow the instructions for the lab work, pay some effort on the mid term and the final exam.

reviews.comment_grading: Very good grade. Getting full mark in assignments and over 90% in final exam means you get an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only three assignments, one midterm and one final.
All of them are very easy.

reviews.author: Reallyreallygdg
reviews.title: Best class
reviews.comment_content:
It consists of a paper format of quiz and assignments ,which require submission of coded excel file, and final exam .For assignment, you just need to follow the steps written on the password protected website specialized for this course then you will get exactly expected results.
The content was very exciting and every homework for excel coding was very practical and fun to do. i still remember an assignment using excel coding to play the piano. As this was my first coding experience, it gave me the feeling that coding is actually amazing.
reviews.comment_teaching: The mode of delivery was great the teacher's voice is calm and she focuses on understanding the mechanisms behind the code slowly so that listeners feel easy to get the concept. Teaching assistants were helpful if asking questions.
reviews.comment_grading: It was my first class that i got A- so if you do it with passion then high results could be obtained reletively easily. Final exam was hard, especially the last question which may require deep understaning of every concept and repeated practice.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not high as assignments only need to follow the guidelines anf submit the results then get good marks.But make sure you have loads of practice of hard codes before final exam

reviews.author: kycv
reviews.comment_content:
Basic uses of Excel and coding with VBA.
The excel part is very useful. Using VBA can also facilitate data handling in excel. However, for coding, it is not useful as other popular programming languages like Python and C++. For SENG students, I recommend to enroll in COMP1021 instead.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Excellent (for this semester).
Due to social unrest, the final exam is cancelled. Only the 4 labs and midterm exam is used to calculate the overall score. Since the midterm exam is very easy, it is easy to get 95+ in overall score (which must be in A range).
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light.
Every week a lab, but not all lab are need to be graded (only 4 out of 8).

reviews.author: KancolleRailgun
reviews.comment_content: The content is pretty easy to understand. First part is the basic of the usage of excel, then second part is dive into the topic of VBA.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is lively and David explain the topics is easy to understand. If you have any question in the class, you can find him after class, he will stay there for some minute to answer student questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Exams are open book and notes, the questions are straight forward, not too hard.
reviews.comment_workload: The labs are not too bad, the TA in the labs are very helpful, some of the labs even guide you through the tasks, almost copy and paste.

reviews.author: 準雷
reviews.title: 好靚grade既course(可惜尾班車已開出)
reviews.comment_content:
開頭會先教Excel既基本野
姐係formula個堆
如果平時有用開/中學讀ICT應該無難度
之後就會正式入VBA教你識program
會用到唔同concept
例如loop if等等

reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. CHAN 教得幾好

同時會開Excel VBA親自示範功能
比我地更加明白
無咩好講

Lab變左做consultation

有source就仲好

Open Book Exam

84都A真係好靚grade

reviews.comment_workload:
唔重

記一記D code點用就ok

reviews.author: babylion
reviews.comment_content: The content is easy to get. Basic Excel formulas and VBA programs. Very easy for people who have taken ICT as their electives in secondary.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson's lectures are interesting and easy to understand the content. The content is very easy as Gibson will have many examples to let us understand it.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean is quite high (>90) for lab work, which means you must be very careful in answering the question. Work harder for the midterm and exam to score an A.
reviews.comment_workload: Both exams are open-book, and thus you don't need to memorize the syntax and function names and details; a throughout understanding of the logic is sufficient.

reviews.author: jusxyz
reviews.comment_content: First few lessons are about basic use of excel worksheet. Content of vba starts at around week 2 or week 3. It is a little bit hard for vba part. Make sure you ask when you do not understand as some concepts builds up from the previous concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching: Cecia is a nice instructor. Feel free to ask her questions after lesson or through email.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is quite good. There are a few grading labs and please do all of it as it is a good way to obtain marks. For the first 4 labs, you can just follow the lab video and copy the steps. The last lab requires you to finish it on your own. Midterm is easier when compared to the final.
reviews.comment_workload: Only 5 grading labs + 1 midterm + 1 final

reviews.author: c__
reviews.title: Fun course
reviews.comment_content:
The first few lessons were focusing on how to use excel and basic cell functions such as average, vlookup and hlookup. Then the next few classes introduce some basic VBA and how to type VBA codes. After midterm, the content gets a bit harder but still manageable.
Good course for people who are interested in coding or problem-solving.
reviews.comment_teaching: Cecia is a very nice instructor. She tries to answer all students' questions and doesn't mind repeating herself. The TA (Peter) is also very nice. He does all the lab recordings and usually explains the process very well, so the first few labs were easy. But for the last few labs, he will leave some blanks for you to fill in and finish the codes yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair.
There are a total of 5 graded labs. I highly recommend doing all the labs (including the non-graded ones) to have more practice writing the VBA codes. Most people get full marks on the labs, so make sure you don't lose marks or make stupid mistakes. You can always check if your code is correct by running the VBA code.
Midterm exam was quite straightforward.
Final exam was harder, so remember to revise all the lecture notes and have more practice.
I got full marks for the labs, above mean for midterm and finals. Received A in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light, only remember to hand in the labs and should be fine. No attendance required.

reviews.author: alisonwingyee
reviews.comment_content:
This course will teach you basic stuff about Excel like cell formulas. You will also learn basic Excel VBA coding.
The contents are quite practical, and I am sure that you will find it useful in your future job. Highly recommend taking this course!!!
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is such a nice and funny person. He could teach things clearly and in a fun way at the same time. Those TAs are also really nice. They always answer questions in detail.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is quite nice. I got full marks in all required labs. As for midterms and finals, my marks were above mean about 1 SD on average. I got an A- eventually.
(Don't be afraid when you see your marks! The mean is relatively low compared to the busi courses I have taken.)
reviews.comment_workload:
Actually, there was no assignment but labs. Some labs were required to be finished while some didn't. However, I do recommend finishing all the labs as it will be useful for your midterm and final.
The time spent on each lab was about 2 hours on average. Most of the answers of the labs were provided in the tutorial video. Therefore, the means of the required labs were nearly 100 marks.

reviews.author: jimccy_602
reviews.title: good
reviews.comment_content: vba basics, not practical in workplace, but you can learn basic vba.
reviews.comment_teaching: very good, they are all very nice and good tutor and professors, which you can have a very nice time in learning.
reviews.comment_grading: A, very easy. the a range is large, many students can get a A- or above in this course. labs almost 100, midterm and final only 67 and 78, but still get a A in grade, which is better than java and python.
reviews.comment_workload: 6 Labs, need to go to labs to do, but they are easy. Mid term and Final exam.

reviews.author: Brian04
reviews.title: Great course!
reviews.comment_content: VBA programming for beginners. Even you are not familiar with programming at all, you will not think that this course is difficult. Also, the content is very valuable and useful for business student. You will be learning how to use vba programming language to create macros, draw shapes in excel, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is fun, you will never feel bored in his lecture. He always tried his best to explain the content so that even the beginners can understand. You will definitely enjoy the jokes he tells in lectures. Also, Gibson and the teaching assistants are always willing to respond to your questions, so that you can truly understand the content. Once, I encountered some problems when I was finishing my lab assignment, I emailed the teaching assistant and he gave me a clear explanation within a day.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. You just have to study hard and you will get a nice grade. If you work hard, the content in midterm and final will not be challenging at all.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy at all. You have to submit some lab assignments in the semester. However, the assignments are not difficult at all.

reviews.author: Weeeee
reviews.comment_content:
2 parts : Basic excel functions and VBA programming

No Attendance is required.
reviews.comment_teaching:
nice professor with crystal clear teaching.

The powerpoints slides are comprehensive, which provides detailed steps.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading.

You will get a good grade if you go through all the slides and assignments before mid-term and final exam.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not really have a lot of works to do.

You just need to complete the assignments with sufficient instructions, so they can done shortly.

Better complete all the assignments and practice all the codes regularly to secure a good grade.

reviews.author: khwong
reviews.comment_content:
Basic knowledge of VBA in excel.

Useful if you use excel a lot.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson really did a great job in teaching us VBA. Instead of teaching use by reading the Power Point he do more demo instead.

I remember one time I really don't know how to do the lab , and I ask him for help. He didn't turn me down and answers all my questions one by one.
reviews.comment_grading: I got B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is minimum. Have some labs but its ok because you can follow the tutorial video.

Exam and Mid term are alright if you understand all the lab.

reviews.author: D:
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty easy to follow. The contents are basic and should not be too hard to understand everything.

For students learning the basic principle of VBA this course will be fun because its content is general. There are even topics on how to make games and shapes, so for those who are interested it will be very enjoyable
reviews.comment_teaching: Kinda boring. Everything he talked about can be found in his notes so for people who wish to skip his classes there won't be any big misses.
reviews.comment_grading: The grades are kinda lenient. Did mediocre but scored a B+ in the end. As long as you finish your assignments on time and don't too bad on the midterm and final exam you should be good to go.
reviews.comment_workload: There's not much work to be done for this course. Besides midterm and final exams there are only assignments, and you do not need to spend a lot of time revising for the exams.

reviews.author: jjthunderdog
reviews.title: Quite good
reviews.comment_content:
All course contents are included in PPT and the course website.
Not really difficult to understand and the examples demonstrated in class is quite straight forward.
The final part of the course about Recursion might be challenging.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson is good.
the learning atmosphere is lively

TA will offer full guidance during the lab session.
reviews.comment_grading:
It will be quite good if you have experience in programming, studied ICT, or have good logical thinking.

both the midterm and final are open book exam, prepare your notes.

Two-way grading.
The midterm is optional.
the weighting of the midterm could be shifted to lab and final.

Final grading:
Average (excluding zeros):  48.0
Standard deviation:  22.0
reviews.comment_workload:
There isn't any takehome assignment in the lecture

Labworks are essential. Although only half of them would count into final grade, the others are likely to be covered in the final exam, so better complete them.

reviews.author: htwww
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the contents before mid-term are about the basic excel formulas. After that, all is about VBA.

I think it is easy for students to handle the first part(excel formulas) cause it is just easy to understand.
However, it is quite challenging when learning the VBA if you are not familiar with computer stuff. So do the lab exercises and examples again to make sure you really understand the contents and logic before the final.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson's teaching is good and quite funny. He will explain the contents and logic clearly. So I enjoy attending his lessons even it is on Zoom.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair. This semester is online mode.
The mid-term is not that hard. The questions are tricky. So double-check before submit to avoid some careless mistakes.
For the final, it is pretty hard...

Assessment weighting:
4 lab each 10% (total 40%)
Midterm 20%
Final exam 40%

Me
Labs All 100
Midterm below mean
Final Above mean (<0.5sd)
Final Grade = B
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite low. Every week has one lab work. No attendance required. No other assignment.

You only need to review the contents before the mid-term and final. But if you want a good grade, please finish all the example exercises and understand the logic behind the examples and labs.

So it is a good choice for you to fulfill the common core requirement!

reviews.author: ehk118
reviews.title: Good grading and useful content~~
reviews.comment_content:
Content includes basic excel formula and basic VBA, which are really useful.

Recommend to buy the textbook for preparing exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Best professor in UST.
Fun and interactive teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading!!! No computer science background is still okay. Just do more exercise and be careful!!

s.d.: 15.7

Final grade: A

(*Tip: Remember to print out the Lab materials! Some of the questions are from lab materials)
reviews.comment_workload:
Very very light workload compared to other courses in UST.

Lab is quite easy. Just need to follow instructions. Better not skip the lab.

reviews.author: No,Thankyou!
reviews.comment_content:
You can see other people.
Excel formula & VBA

no attendance required.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson teaching is quite clear and understandable. However, I didn't work hard on this course so I only get B grade. But this is my problem la. Gibson is good. As long as you work hard in this course, you can get good grade la I think.
reviews.comment_grading:
This semester is online mode. The final exam is very difficult.
Assessment weighting:
4 lab each 10% (total 40%)

Final exam 40%

mean:

me

reviews.comment_workload:
light.
TA will teach you almost all the steps in lab. You just need to follow the instruction to type/copy the code from assignment page. (most of the time, code will be given in lab page.) Read careful the assessment requirements and fulfill it.
The difficulties of midterm is acceptable. However, the final exam is very difficult in this online semester. So the mean is very low.

reviews.author: Alex Kwok
reviews.comment_content: First excel then VBA. Should be easy if you can finish your homework on your own. If you want to study CS or CPEG don't choose this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson is very funny and passionate. I am sure you will enjoy his class. He talks quite fast but still easy to follow.
TAs in lab are very helpful.
reviews.comment_grading:
Open book exam
Midterm is optional but I recommend you attend.
If you answer questions during lessons, you can get bonus points which count toward your final grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
They say labs are compulsory but they are not indeed.
You can do the labs at home.
If you are really that lazy then you basically have one lab every 1-2weeks and just one final exam which is open book.

reviews.author: ykl128
reviews.title: Just finished the midterm xd
reviews.comment_content:
I would say VBA is very interesting at the moment  as I have not finished this course lol. But I would like to make this review because of Cecia <3
For people who like mathematics/ solving logical problems, you will like this course.

As I am not a student with CS-related background, this is my only COMP course in my u life. I would say it is a relatively simple course, easy to understand, train more on your thinking skills rather than memorising things.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I am in Gibson class. He is a funny guy, but I think he talked a little bit fast, I could not catch up with his pace (it may be my problem)

Thanks to the online lectures, I can join other lecturers' section. From then, I started attending Cecia's class. I really enjoy her class, she is very patient and so nice. She may include some warm up exercise to help us review the previous lecture content. In general, I really like her teaching. I think her class is very suitable for students who may need more time to digest the concepts.

Also, Peter, our TA, is very nice too. He is delivering the lab content very clearly. and I rmb I emailed him for enquiries, then he replied me at 6am the other day. very responsive and helpful!
reviews.comment_grading:
I have not finished the course, I will update another review at the end of this semester.

for exam, usually exam is more difficult than the practice tests and review questions.
reviews.comment_workload:
pretty light.
4 labs, midterm and final exam
labs: just pay attention to the TA, then you will get everything done within 1 hour for each lab.

reviews.author: below_mean_guy
reviews.comment_content:
First part was about excel formulas, the later part was about VBA.

All exam questions are short questions and open-book, so what you need is to think logically and give the correct final answers, steps are not important.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good professor, you will not feel bored in his lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Originally, there are two schemes and the better grade from the schemes will be calculated:
labs 40%, midterm 20%, final 40%; or
labs 44%, midterm 0%, final 56%.
In this way you can get a good grade even if you perform not so well in midterm.

However, in this semester, it is changed to:
midterm 33.32%, labs 66.68%

Also, the professor asks questions in the lecture, and randomly picks people to answer the question. You get 0.5% bonus points for each correctly answered question.

For reference, my grades:
labs 100%
midterm 91%
Bonus 2.5 (5 questions answered)
Final grade A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 4 labs to hand in, and there are step by step guidelines and marking schemes on the website, so it is easy to follow and get high score.

Beside labs, only midterm and final (which was cancelled in this semester).

reviews.author: samson0049
reviews.comment_content: 基本上個課程好小野讀 一開始嗰啲加減乘除同你起中學用計數機冇乜分別 係VBA開始嗰到會多啲啲野 但係其實來來去去都係得幾條式 只要睇得明example基本上就冇大問題
reviews.comment_teaching: 佢起堂上面會周不時問人問題如果你怕悶嘅話唔使擔心 但係如果你想毒坐一角就可能麻煩小小 因為佢有時都幾中意抽啲唔係爆四位嘅人來問 大致上佢教學上係好清楚明白解釋得十分詳盡 同埋佢用大量嘅例子來解釋啲內容
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term 100
Lab 100
Final ~90
Grade A+
雖然佢有兩個scheme 一個計mid term一個唔計 但係佢mid term之前考得容易過final好多 基本上輕輕讀一讀都可以8字頭 所以個人覺得寧願mid term認真啲去考 final輕鬆小小會更加開心
reviews.comment_workload: 做lab如果上齊堂來做唔會有啲咩大問題 不過如果reg中咗9點嘅lab就可能會辛苦小小

reviews.author: Shum Lik Hang
reviews.comment_content:
Basic formulae of Excel
Then head to VBA part
Not much hard concept.
reviews.comment_teaching: He creates a very good atmosphere in every lesson by making jokes. He teaches very well as he always makes good explanation and demonstrations.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grading as all exams are open book exam.
Very easy to get A range if you try to do the past paper he gave and print out all the powerpoint and codes of the lab work.
reviews.comment_workload: Very little workload as lab work is very straight forward, only need to answer easy questions every lesson to get a bonus point.

reviews.author: dcba
reviews.comment_content: Content is quite useful and helps you to get a bit of understanding of what programming languages are like.
reviews.comment_teaching: He has a clear teaching style. Easy to understand.
reviews.comment_grading: Not hard to get A. But make sure to get perfect scores on all lab assignments and review all ppts and that you can apply the knowledge in various situations. It is important if you can actually apply the theories into real life, unexpected situation, not the theories itself!
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload. But better attend labs so that you don't need to do the lab assignments by yourself.

reviews.author: Sussi
reviews.title: Take for free GPA
reviews.comment_content: VBA programming language specifically in Excel. An interesting although not entirely pragmatic course that teaches fundamental programming skills in entertaining ways. Content can pretty much be self-taught as it is not overtly difficult and his power points are concise and useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: By far the most entertaining teacher I've had at UST so far. He has a quirky yet amiable sense of humor that makes the lectures seem to go by so fast. He frequently asks students questions pertaining to what he is teaching which can earn you an extra 0.5% to add on to your final grade if you get them right, or if he thinks you've tried hard enough to answer. His English proficiency is in a whole nother category of its own in comparison to most UST professors.
reviews.comment_grading: You'll attain a good grade assuming you manage to score high on the relatively easy exams. Only issue would be that the means are so high that even small errors can cost you a while grade, but this in it of itself shouldn't be an issue as the questions asked in the Midterms and Finals are not that hard. Also the Lab assignments are provided to us with a mark scheme so its easy to check and predict your scores for them.
reviews.comment_workload: Very managble. On average there is about one Lab assignment which can take 30mins to 2hrs depending on the specific one. Most require overlapping skills that are taught to you throughout the course so by the end of it you'll be easily able to complete the, without going to tutorials (they're optional).

reviews.author: King619
reviews.title: Easy Course
reviews.comment_content: a lot of basic stuff but really useful at the same time. actual programming starts in the second month.
reviews.comment_teaching: David is a wonderful professor, teaches in a funny way. there is a course website where you can find the materials for the course and teacher assistants will upload videos to assist in your labs.
reviews.comment_grading: if you attend most of the classes, a b grade is guaranteed. Grades are based on midterms, finals, labs and additional questions asked by the professor during lectures
reviews.comment_workload: only 5 compulsory labs I think, for the first 3 labs, the teacher assistants will go through them with you 100%

reviews.author: Ariel Lai
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content: Before midterm basically is simple excel formulas but after midterm is talking about VBA, coding stuff , not really difficult, but tricky.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson teaching is clear and fun. I enjoy his lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not as good grade as I thought. Because  final in the semester I take is SO DIFFICULT. But some still got full marks...
It is hard to get high marks but I think above mean still got pretty good grades.
reviews.comment_workload: Only lab each week .Need to spend some time on it. Maybe 2-3 hours , or you can just go to the lab session and copy the answer !

reviews.author: Matthewl

reviews.comment_content:
Very basic programming.
variables, functions, if-else statement, loop, array...etc. But the assessed way is easy so no worry.
It offers the most important concepts that you can see almost every prgramming language and i think it is a good language for starters.

Professor Lam is very funny.

reviews.comment_grading:
The best grade I ever had.
Full marks in labs

Got 1 bonus question
Overall I got a A+(With this level of performance,A+ is guaranteed)
reviews.comment_workload:
Appropriate.
Contents taught in class are easy stuff.
Labs need you to think a little bit more
Exams are more challenging but if you truly put effort on it, you will get good grade.

reviews.author: KS-24
reviews.title: Great Course
reviews.comment_content: Quite useful content for Excel and VBA. Besides teaching VBA codes it helps you with daily Exce Applications and it will be useful for future studies and career.
reviews.comment_teaching: Funny Lecturer. Never felt boring in his lecture. Sometimes he will ask us some questions and giving the correct answer earns some marks of final grading.
reviews.comment_grading: As long as you are familiar with the lecture slides, assigments and labs you are good to go. The exams are open book. You can bring your notes in case you forget something.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy. The assignments are easy. The important thing is to attend labs regularly if falling behind. The TAs are helpful and willing to solve your problem.

reviews.author: jcheng17
reviews.title: Probably the best course in your 4 years of university
reviews.comment_content: Super easy, just super easy, you can skip all the classes you want after he first class, but please take some time to read through the powerpoints.
reviews.comment_teaching: Rossiter is the best prof. I’ve seen so far, humorous, good presentation. He will randomly choose someone to answer his question in class, but its ok to don’t know the answer so don’t be nervous.
reviews.comment_grading: Got a B without much effort. I have literally zero knowledge about computer science, didn’t put the lab’s codes into cheatsheet cuz I’m too lazy, skipped most of the class, didn’t attend any non-handin labs, still gets a B. So don’t be like me, work harder and I’m sure you can get an A. Add oil.
reviews.comment_workload:
Some handin labs. There are other extra labs that don’t require you to handin, but all the labs could be asked on exams so make sure to attend all of them and save the codings to ur account for your cheatsheet if you wanna have good grades.

The biggest workload is to prepare a good cheatsheet, here are some common advice:
- Don’t just make code list for your cheat sheet, make a little section about each code with some simple definition and examples.
- Big font and different colour for the topic of the section, so you can find the section you need asap
- Put all the labs’ codes with explanations into the cheatsheet

Please do the exam sample before the exam, its really useful.

Good luck bois and gurs, you can do it.

reviews.author: Dean.T
reviews.title: Quite good
reviews.comment_content: As the title of the course suggests, it is a beginner programming course about Excel. The content is mostly about the basic knowledge of VBA. Some may say that there are too much materials to be covered, but both mid-term and final are open-booked exams, so I guess it is okay.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Gibson is a very passionate professor, he will expand everything very clearly, I don't recommend you to skip the lecture if you are not sure about the concepts.

TA also gives out clear instruction for the lab work, so if you want to have some base marks for the lab work, make sure you don't skip the tutorials as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are two grading scheme, the one which gives you the highest grade will be used.

1.midterm 20%, lab work 40%, final exam 40%
2.midterm 0%, lab work 44%, final exam 56%

In case, if you performed not so well in the mid-term, you can still catch up in the final.

There is also bonus lecture marks, if you answered the questions which are raised by the professor during the lecture, you will get a bonus 0.5% to your final marks.

One thing to be careful is that although the course gives out good grade, there can also be some tricky parts in the questions, just don't let your guard down.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite low. Lectures and tutorials are not compulsory.
However, you will need to hand in 4 lab work for marking which will be counted towards your final marks.

reviews.author: omg
reviews.title: Excellent content with ease understanding
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is improving each year, and it’s already designed to quite easy to understand. If you attend the lectures and work hand on hand on the additional exercise, there should be no problem for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good. Cecia could teach us according to our level and adjust her teaching pace. She is also very nice and will answer all your idiot questions.
reviews.comment_grading: I got and A in the end. There is two option in grading, either consider both midterm and exam or exam only. Labs also counted but most of them can get full mark. One thing to suggest is don’t all in to your final. Because the trend seems to be a easy midterm and extremely hard final.(At least for both spring and fall last year) Therefore the midterm may save your grade if you did bad in the final.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost no workload at all. Only need to attend the labs, (you even need not to attend if you know how to do)  but labs and lectures usually include tips. Just revise the day before exam and midterm.

reviews.author: whpang
reviews.comment_content:
Excel VBA coding and Basic excel coding.
Easy and interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Funny and Easy, You can get extra credit by answering pop up questions in class which is quite easy.  If you are confident enough to have a good grade in the final, you can choose not to answer.
reviews.comment_grading:
The final exam does not mainly focus on vba coding.  It focuses more details and logical thinking.  Try to think step by step instead of jumping to the conclusion immediately.
Unlimited cheat sheet is allowed.
reviews.comment_workload:
Easy.
Step by Step teaching in tutorial lessons.
You can ask as many questions as you like.
Try to do the homework on your own first.  Ask the TA when you have questions.

reviews.author: shcchong
reviews.title: good course
reviews.comment_content: if you have programming exp will be perfect.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is quite amusing
reviews.comment_grading: it is really easy to get good grade  without lot of effort. i got A- with just few hours of review before exams.
reviews.comment_workload: you can choose not to attend any lesson of the course if you have basic programming skills. just remember to check which lab is graded and check for the instructions then do them all. if you have source, you can try to use them , but you need to check them carefully before submitting.

reviews.author: SiuL
reviews.title: Interesting and light workload course
reviews.comment_content:
Very easy.

This course is about how to use Excel VBA, mainly focusing on the coding and logic behind writing codes. They will teach you the most commonly used commands such as IF, LOOKUP. If you had taken IT courses before this course will be a piece of cake. If you hadn't this course will still be a piece of cake to you as the content requires little time to review and understand.

The first half of the course consists of some excel basic knowledge that even primary students will know if they had taken their IT courses such as the definition of a spreadsheet (which of course will not be asked in exam), basic cell formulas. Another half of the course is also very easy to understand, such as looping and basic cell formatting.

In fact, the course is so easy that you can understand all the lesson materials just by reading the lecture notes, you don't need to attend any lectures at all (in my opinion).
reviews.comment_teaching:
Streamlined and Sophisticated.

Gibson is one of the best lecturers I've seen (though to be fair as a year 1 student I haven't seen much), his lessons are interesting, used a lot of gags and jokes to stir up the atmosphere, he also uses very simple and easy examples to help students understand the concept of the class.

Questions will be asked during each lecture and if you answered it correctly you will be awarded 0.5% towards your final grade.

Each week they will have 1 lab, a mini-project/ homework that helps you understand the concepts and the implementation of codes. Without a doubt, those labs are very well organized, while doing the lab you're simultaneously learning and revising the lecture material. The lab is so good that if you've done all the labs you don't even need to read the lecture notes to learn the content.
reviews.comment_grading:
This semester's grading is quite good in general.

This course was regarded as one of the best courses in UST. Easy to learn with very high grades. However, this year is an exception.

The course has 4 lab work, 1 mid-term exam and 1 final exam, by the way all exams are open book open notes exam.

This course has two ways to count your final grade. I've forgotten the exact method, but basically, final exam counts around 50%, mid-term 30% and labs 20%. The second way is final 60%, labs 40%. The instructors will automatically choose the method that will result in a higher score.

My score:
Lab total: 97.5/100

Midterm: 62/100
Mean: 62.37
S.D: 24.22

Final: 83/100
Mean: 48
S.D: 22

My Total: 84.6%, Final grade A.

As you can see the final exam is disastrous. Never have I seen a 1000 level course having a lower than 50% mean score. Bear in mind this is an open book exam. Though to be fair it doesn't really help even if you had your notes, since the exam had focused a lot on logical deduction which required a focused-mind and clear head. To conclude almost no revision is required, but you'd better make sure you're clear about the concepts of coding.
reviews.comment_workload:
The only homework for the course is lab work aforementioned, better still only half of them are counted towards your final grade, which means there's only a lab work biweekly.

Each lab work is a simple mini-project using excel spreadsheets that takes around 1 hour to finish, such as making a search up page for MTR fare.

Lab project will be taught in lab sessions and you can finish that homework while attending that session. If you missed that session you have around 5 days to do it yourself and hand in via canvas.  Moreover, each lab will have a sophisticated step-by-step guide teaching you how to write the codes almost LINE BY LINE. Even a primary student can finish the lab under that level of instruction.

reviews.author: HKUST civl
reviews.comment_content: 頭三個禮拜講下啲好簡單嘅excel formula，基本上自己睇notes已經搞掂，之後就教vba language，包括variables, looping, if function, excel event, arrays, recursion, objects等
reviews.comment_teaching: gibson算系我係ust見過教得最好嘅professor，冇口音，熱心回答你嘅問題，落堂可以chur住佢不停問，email佢都好快覆。其實齋睇notes已經好易明，但建議大家去上佢嘅堂，因為佢會將一啲比較複雜嘅concept用好簡單易明嘅方式例子去解釋，如果自己睇要半個鐘先明，佢十分鐘已經可以教到你明，最重要系佢上堂會時不時講下爛gap，雖然唔多人笑，但比起其他professor嘅堂，已經有趣好多。
reviews.comment_grading:
兩種計法，具體percent我記得，大約系：
midterm 30% lab 20% final 50%
如果你炒咗midterm，可以唔計midterm
final 60% lab 40%
lab其實只要有attend 跟住ta做已經滿分，最多留最後一個位自己做，但都唔難，都系唔識做嘅話可以chur下ta，佢會教埋你點做。
堂上回答問題有bonus分，但都系最多5%

我lab 90%
mid term74/100 above半個sd
final 64/100  above 1個sd
最後A-咗
超好grade
reviews.comment_workload: 每星期都有lab，但hand in lab得4份，其他可以唔去，hand in lab其實自己睇notes已經做到，去到都系跟ta做，完全唔識都可以滿分。

reviews.author: Sanbok
reviews.title: 值得一上嘅course
reviews.comment_content: 內容圍繞Excel formula 同埋VBA, 中學有讀ICT嘅會比較容易，就算冇讀到幾容易上手。
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor 教得好好亦好俾心機教
reviews.comment_grading: 因為個course嘅內容比較簡單所以競爭會比較大
reviews.comment_workload: Lecture lab都唔會take attendance，但係lab work就計分，lab 堂有Professor同埋TA會教你做，或者自己喺屋企做Online交都得。總共8個lab， 4份計分

reviews.author: emily228
reviews.comment_content: It covers some basic excel functions which I believe many of us have already known. The major part of this course is about VBA coding, and helps you to develop a computer-language mindset, which I think it is quite useful and applicable in the future.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson is one of the best professors I have met in UST. He teaches with heart and tires to make lessons fun.
reviews.comment_grading: The final grade contributes to mid-term exam (optional), final exam(60%) and Lab assignments(40%). I fully got that 40% Lab contribution like most of the other students, MT and final both score 1 s.d. above and the final grade is B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light. If you can finish the Lab assignment on your own, you can skip the lab secession. However, if you are not sure whether you can handle it, the lab tutor will show you the complete answer, so I recommend students with no computer science background to attend the Lab.

reviews.author: marcochowhy
reviews.title: Interesting course
reviews.comment_content: It is an introductory course of students with any trials in programming. It is about using excel to programme some interesting functions and mini-games. The exam questions are MC and some fill-in the blanks question. You are required to choose the correct coding for the expected result.
reviews.comment_teaching: Rossiter, David is a perfect teacher. You are lucky if u are staying in his class. You won't fall asleep because his teaching style is to interact with students. You can get bonus marks if you answer the questions correctly in class
reviews.comment_grading: It is an open book exam which means u can bring all the teaching materials into the exam venue. You don't have to memorise anything but just understand the theory behind. I got an A grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Just a few lab project/ assignment that can be handled easily. Some lab tutorial sessions are not essential to show up, but it would be better for understanding the programming logic behind. Low workload, it won't be a great course for year one student who just starts their university journey.

reviews.author: 23V
reviews.title: Easier than other two comp courses
reviews.comment_content: The course includes basic knowledge of the application of Microsoft Excel and Visual Basic.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is nice. The course instructor Cecia organizes the teaching materials and resources really nicely, and she can explain everything clearly and precisely.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is rather good. If you get full score in all the lab work, it is not that difficult to get a A range. Mid term is optional. And all the exams are open-noted, which means they are actually testing your comprehension and understanding on the topics rather than memorization.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is reasonable. There are totally 8 lab works, four of which are hand-in lab which counts in your final grade. If you attend every lecture and complete each lab work, it's easy to obtain a satisfying result on this course.

reviews.author: aidanli2000
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is pretty easy to get, before the mid terms it is focused on the excel functions like VLOOKUP while after mid term you will learn more about VBA, the hardest topic is recursion
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching style is quite fun amd interactive, however the exams seems to differ quite alot from what he teaches
reviews.comment_grading: the average of the midterm was in the 65s while final was 48, the grading seems quite fair, I got above 0.5sd in mid term and 1.2sd in final and ended up with A

reviews.author: I_am_not
reviews.comment_content: The content can be divided into 2 parts. The first part is about some background information of excel and the second part is about VBA programming.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson creates a light-hearted atmosphere for the class but so how I think he is too fast during lessons when going through the powerpoints. And Gibson doesn't videotape his lessons, unlike those who attend the course in fall sem which got lecture videos, so it is better not to skip classes if you are not that good at computer stuff and there are chances for bonus marks lectures so try not to skip them.

reviews.comment_workload: Very low workload. Even if you don't attend the lecture, you can just read through the notes which is available on the website. The notes are easy to understand. The assignment can do it by yourself so you don't need to go to the lab session. In the lab section, TAs are willing to teach you or even give you the code for doing it.

reviews.author: GubsW
reviews.comment_content: First three weeks are basic formula of excel sheet and the remaining are VBA coding.
reviews.comment_teaching: Gibson's lecture are interesting and easy to understand the content. The content are very easy as Gibson will have many example to let us understand it.
reviews.comment_grading: Good grading. Exam are open book/notes. Lab 40% Midterm 20% and Final 40%. If final exam result are very high, result of mid term can be ignored.
reviews.comment_workload: Most of the lab works are very easy and most parts are guided by TA. 2 Lectures which 50 mins in each lecture  and 3 hours lab session.

reviews.author: couch_potato
reviews.title: Absolute reversal of UST course stereotypes
reviews.comment_content:
The course mainly teaches Excel VBA programming, covering an overview of Excel and cells functions, VBA logic, loops, shapes and operations, as well as more advanced stuff like arrays, recursion and object, which are all rarely used in Excel VBA due to the availability of cells as object instances. 2D arrays are also out of syllabus, which comes to me as a joke, since both the other introductory courses have this programming logic.

I would say this course is useful for office and work applications, but pretty much useless for learning actual programming concepts or as a prerequisite to the much higher-class COMP2011.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I absolutely adore Gibson.

His lessons are really fun, and he can always take the seemingly complicated codes and dumb it down to a level that even junior secondary students have no trouble understanding the codes. A very good lecturer for absolute beginners in programming.

He is also pretty knowledgeable in other programming languages, and is able to present comparison of VBA to other programming languages to help students determine which programming introduction course is the most suitable for them.
reviews.comment_grading:
This course has traditionally been one of the best graded courses at HKUST, as well as the easiest among the 3 1000-level programming introduction choices. However, this semester has subverted all expectations, and I hereby announce that COMP1022Q has officially turned from an easy, good grade course into a course with terrible grading and difficulty.

As always, both exams are open book exams.

Participation bonus:
The instructor asks a question in class related to the lecture content, and the person who answers the question correctly gets 0.5% bonus each time, so my advice is to be proactive and seize the chance to answer, because Gibson allows that and he takes quite a long time to randomly pick a student.

There are 2 grading schemes:
Scheme 1: All in final
Final exam: 56%
Lab: 44%

Scheme 2: Mid-term score included
Mid-term: 20%
Final: 40%
Lab: 40$

Statistics:
Mid-term mean: 62.4/100
Mid-term SD: 24.2
Final mean: 47.5/100
Final SD: 22
Lab mean: >95/100

My score:
Lab: 100%
Mid-term: 82/100
Final: 97/100
Participation bonus: 3 times, +1.5%

A+ with scheme 2, 99.8%

I would say I got lucky, to be honest.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is a lab each week, while you get some weeks off, so there are 8 labs in total. There is indeed some work involved, but it isn't really that hard, especially if you go to the assigned lab session.

Both exams are, as always, open book, and thus you have no need of trying to memorize the syntax and function names and details; a throughout understanding of the logic is sufficient.

reviews.author: tommytang02163
reviews.title: 2017-18 Fall
reviews.comment_content: This course teaches you some of the common formulas you can use in Excel, which will be useful for your future career. You can also learn how to execute Excel through VBA, a bit like programming, you can control what you want, and Excel can run it automatically.
reviews.comment_teaching: His speech is very interesting, in fact you will not be bored when you are in class. His speech always makes us laugh, always ask questions (if you answer correctly, it will be marked), the communication between students and professors is very good. His voice will definitely attract your attention and the learning atmosphere is also very good.
reviews.comment_grading:
The score is not very good, maybe someone can still get a high score.
One might think that this is a good scoring course, and in order to make as much effort as possible, this makes the boundaries of the results so high, I think it is also one of the competitive courses.
reviews.comment_workload: Almost zero ZERO workload. There are several labs that can count your final grades. The instructor will show you step by step in the lab section, and you can complete the experiment as you wish.

reviews.comment_teaching: David taught the class in an entertaining way. The lecture is quite interesting but the content is easy so I just read the ppt by myself. Lab session just needs to copy everything the tutor did and ask for help if you have any difficulties and you can almost full mark.
reviews.comment_grading: The score of assignments, mid-term and final are quite high but they are relatively easy. Enough preparation should ensure a good grade easily.
reviews.comment_workload: Assignment needs to submit every two weeks but can be finished easily in the lab session. there is almost no workload at all

reviews.author: ChuiJai
reviews.title: Quite an interesting course
reviews.comment_content: Content is about basic excel formulas and also excel programming called VBA. It does not need former knowledge in programming as the course will start from the basics and slowly progress to indepth knowledge of the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: David is a fun character always making jokes and full of energy while teaching. The Power points are clear and the teaching are easy to follow. All teaching materials can be accessed from the comp1022q website.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is really good. There will be a mid term and final, assignments will also be included in the grading.
You are allowed to bring books and notes into the exam, so you can find the answers from it. Although the exams are open book, you still need to understand the usage of different formulas of the program and the logic flow of different programs to get good grades. Just be careful and study all lab programs and highlight the important formulas in the notes so you can find the necessary information in the notes.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is not high having 8 labs but only 4 is graded. There will be teaching assistants during the lab period. Attending all lab sessions is encourage so you can experience building your own program and learn from the mistakes you made in the program. If the lab is non-graded, you don't need to attend the lab session. Steps for completing the programs will be included with little empty components that you need to fill in yourself. Teaching assistants are not allowed to teach these parts so you need to figure out the answer yourself. It may sometimes be time consuming to think of the correct code to put in the program.
Overall the workload the little as mostly it is copy and paste. Not much to prepare for the exams, just remember to print out all necessary notes to bring into the exam hall.

reviews.title: 唔讀會後悔H course

First few lectures are about some basic excel keys and usage.
Then covers about the simple functions in excel. Finally some VBA programming stuff.

**真心好簡單**

The lab part is quite flexible, you can leave the lab if you finish it earlier. **( You can even not go to the lab if that's a not a hand-in  work) Just follow this guiding website instruction and you will save your time, the TA can be ignored.

reviews.comment_content: Lecture notes幾完整, 上堂會cover到9成內容,一開始會教下普通Excel function先到vba,唔上灶可以自己睇ppt
reviews.comment_teaching: 上堂氣氛幾好,david會準備啲問題考人,答問題有0.5%bonus,平時肯答同學問題

reviews.author: ayir
reviews.title: Not a bad course
reviews.comment_content: In the beginning it is mainly some basic Excel work, and will slowly build up to VBA (the actual programming language).  For those without a programming background, this course is really good to get a feel for if you would like to do more of it in the future, as it is one of the most basic languages that can be learnt.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Rossiter is quite entertaining, and constantly tests the class using examples during lectures. He gives out bonus points for every correct answer too.

He mainly presents using a powerpoint presentation that is the same as the one uploaded on the course website. This is makes it easy to access the information earlier if you need to as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is not bad. Most people do quite well. If you are a first-time programmer like I was, you may feel overwhelmed during the midterm but you can quickly catch up.

This course is very friendly in terms of grading - if your midterm brings your overall grade down, they will not include it, and will weight more on your final and labs. This is very beneficial for a lot of students.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework, but practise questions are always uploaded every 1-2 weeks in order to get enough practise with the concepts that you have learnt.

There are several hand-in labs that are generally quite easy to get 100% in. Make sure that any time there is 'optional' work in the lab that you DO IT! Otherwise points will be deducted (even though it is optional).

reviews.author: dlo00
reviews.comment_content:
The first few lectures of the course cover the basics of using Excel, including cell formulas and navigating the spreadsheet in general.
The rest of the course teaches VBA programming. Though I have virtually no experience in programming, the content is easy to follow. Even as someone with no background, I was able to skip a few classes and get away with it.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The instructor answers all students' questions in a helpful manner and does her best to engage students. Lectures can be a bit boring due to the slow pace, but this is so that all students can keep up.
The tutorials are of little help, though it may be helpful to others. The tutorials teach the labs (weekly assignments) step by step; however, the instructions given with the labs are already helpful enough. The pacing of the tutorials was slow and the TA could be a bit unprofessional, making jokes of a sexual nature. By the end of the semester, none of my friends nor I were attending tutorials.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was fair for the most part. Your hand-in labs (4 in total), the midterm, and the final exam all account for your cumulative grade.
The hand-in labs should be easy marks, as you have a week to complete them and they come with very thorough instructions.
The exam format was a bit tricky, and to get a good grade you will need to be very careful with your proofreading and also have a bit of luck. Both the midterm and the final exams are open-book, open-note, and the content was not too difficult. However, if you have any syntax errors in your answer you will get marks deducted. In real life, you would be able to run the code and fix it.
The instructors will calculate your grade with the midterm grade included or excluded, and give you the higher mark of the two. For this reason, you can choose to not take the midterm.
The instructors also ask questions in class for bonus marks - 0.5% for each question answered correctly. This is an incentive to attend class.
However, I gave it a B because it is hard to get an A+ - the course is too easy.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was not bad at all, because the labs were easy to complete and were only given on a weekly basis. As well, the content was not so hard that you had to spend too much time revising.

reviews.author: calcguy
reviews.title: Tough Final Exam...
reviews.comment_content:
Part 1: 100% Excel + 0% VBA [Week 1 - Week 3]
* Introduction to Microsoft Excel
* Cell Formulas, IF, HLOOKUP, VLOOKUP, MOD

Part 2: 30% Excel + 70% VBA [Week 4 - Week 13]
* Making Macros, Writing VBA Code for Events
* Message Box, Input Box, Range of VBA Variables (Excluding Variant), Working with Selected Cells
* VBA "If... Else" , "If... ElseIf... Else" Statements
* Looping
* Function and Subroutines
* GUI Handling
* Object Oriented Programming
* Recursion

Too bad there is no ARRAY discussed for this semester, which is an important concept in programming world.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I was enrolled into Prof. David's Lecture. People say that doesn't really matter; you can still go to other lectures (which is Cecia for this term) and obtain bonus points. However, I myself only go to Prof. David's lecture due to my busy term.

For Prof. David, I think he teaches at a right pace, meaning you can at least understand 70% of the materials taught in each lecture, even though new topics are always introduced to us for different lectures.

For the bonus points, based on my observation throughtout the term, he "randonmly" picks a student and ask that person to answer at most 1 question per lecture. He tends to pick people at the back, since I think that people at the back rows do not really pay attention to his lecture, but that certainly has not been the case; those people are still able to answer the questions and obtain those crucial bonus points. **So sad for people sitting at the first 3 rows**
He may also sometimes use a random number generator to determine which rows to be picked.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme 1 [Better]:
40% Lab + 20% Midterm + 40% Final + Bonus Marks
Grading Scheme 2:
44% Lab + 0% Midterm + 56% Final + Bonus Marks

(1) There are 4 hand-in labs (varies within each term); 2 before midterm and 2 after midterm. List of hand-in labs and comments:
* Lab 2: Going Around Hong Kong
It seems to be quite straight-forward if you attend the lab, you just need to copy and paste the codes and 100% is yours.
* Lab 4: Shooting Game
Involves a little bit of VBA, but it is still managable if you attend your lab. However, for this lab, this is NOT a straight-forward copy and paste (you have 1 blank to be figured out by yourself; don't think too hard)
* Lab 5: Jigsaw Game
Not so easy anymore. In fact, if you do not have any idea in compressing or zipping a file, this is a chance for you to learn about it. There are more blanks than the previous hand-in labs, so perhaps you need to think more about it.
* Lab 7: Monster Game
The hardest hand-in lab among all 4. In particular, you have to write several lines of codes on your own for the last part of the assignment.
* List of other labs:
- Lab 3: Guessing Game
- Lab 6: Music System
- Lab 8: Shapes and Sculptures

(2) For the midterm, if you actually have understood all the materials taught in every lecture, then you just need to review the past papers and you should be good for obtaining 80+.

(3) For the final, it seems to be 1.5 times harder than the previous finals (i.e. 2017 fall and 2016 fall). There are many suprise questions indeed, and you need to be careful not falling into any traps. Also, make sure that you write your answers CLEARLY; there are less fill in the blanks and more questions that actually require you to write up at most one FULL line of code.

Statistics: (Mean + SD)
Lab 2: 99.4 + 3.4
Lab 4: 98.2 + 4.9
Lab 5: 98.3 + 6.4
Lab 7: 97.6 + 7.0
Midterm: 77.9 + 16.2
Final: 66.4 + 19.4
Lecture Points: 2.4 ; MAX = 11 ; 187 students obtained at least 1 lecture point (= 0.5 marks)

I got full marks for labs, 1SD above mean for midterm, and 0.4SD above mean for final, and I finally got a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: As long as you follow the instructions on the lab webpages, I think you should be fine to go. For the assignments, the hints are actually less than the ones not handed in for lab marks, so it will be beneficial if you actually go to the lab when there is a lab to be handed in.

reviews.comment_content:
The first part of the course is about basic usage of Excel built-in formulae. The second part of the course is about VBA programming, including codes like 'msgbox', 'inputbox', 'for...next' loop, 'while...wend' loop, 'do...loop', 'instr' etc. Some of the codes may be taught or used in the lab but not during the lecture.

This course is pretty easy in proportion to other comp1022_ courses.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Rossiter is a pretty humorous lecturer, or I should say he tried to maintain a fun atmosphere as the codes may be boring for some students.

It is reminded that some methods may be taught or mentioned during class but not included in the slides. For instance, the way of reversing the spelling of a vocabulary item. So, taking notes or photos on the examples shown in the class may be the way to get a better score in the exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
For data, please refer to the attached file.

2 grading scheme, whichever gives you a higher total score:
1. 20% midterm, 40%final, 40% assignment(5 pieces, 8% each)
2. 60%final, 40%assignment

There are bonus points. For each question answered correctly during class, you can earn 0.4% bonus points.

Prof Rossiter always randomly choose students who wear certain colours of clothes. But if no one can answer the question, you may try to put up your hand instead. Remember to answer him fast but correctly. Should you stumble, I am afraid he will immediately choose another person.

Long questions in the exams are mainly based on the lab assignments. Make sure you understand the concepts behind thoroughly since there may be some subtle change in the program codes which could be misleading if you are not careful enough.
reviews.comment_workload: Not high for me. There are 7 lab assignments which 2 of them are not graded or required to be submitted, but they were tested. Those lab assignments were guided during the lab session so they were not pretty hard. But make sure that you understand how the programs in the lab assignments work as the concepts behind them are important.

reviews.author: Kevin Man
reviews.title: Very fun professor, grading is okay
reviews.comment_content:
This course teaches some common formulae you may use in Excel, which can be useful for your future career. You can also learn how to do Excel by VBA, a little bit like programming, you can control what you want and Excel can run for it automatically.

You actually don't need to memorise the formulae, as you can take any paper notes to the mid-term and final exam.

The content is manageable if you work hard on it.
reviews.comment_teaching: Rossiter's lecture is REALLY FUNNY, actually you won't find it boring when attending his lesson. His speech always make us laugh, and always ask questions(marks will be added if you answer them correctly), the communication between students and the professor is great. People may think that it is a good grading course, and pay a lot of effort on it to get as high as possible, which makes the boundaries of grades so high, I think it is also one of the competitive courses. So I am always below 1 sd, and finally got a C+....maybe I am really weak at computer.

reviews.author: jasperkee
reviews.comment_content: the language taught in the course (VBA) is not difficult, can be easily understood by student without any programming background as well as you pay attention in class.
reviews.comment_teaching: Rossiter's lessons are interesting. His english is easy to follow and the examples covered in the lessons explain the concept well. Some of those examples appear in midterm and final.

reviews.comment_teaching: Rossiter is very funny, there will be a lot of jokes in the lecture. He will also ask questions to keep you focus, you can even get bonus marks if you get them right. He also explained the concepts well and made them easy to understand. Great lecturer.

reviews.author: thm

reviews.comment_content:

Lectures and labs are not compulsory and lecture videos are uploaded before finals.
Both midterm and final are open book and open notes but make sure you understand the logic by studying the codes and doing past papers.  There are exam questions about the codes on lab and there is even a question exactly the same as the past paper!
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is knowledgeable about excel and VBA and is very funny.  He can create a great learning atmosphere.  He includes a lot of examples and demonstrations in class to make the class content easier to understand.
The TAs for the lab sessions are very helpful and are willing to answer any questions regarding the lab or even help you fix bugs.  The content in lab sessions are quite fun as we can use excel to make puzzle games and even a piano which we can play.

if final mark is higher than midterm then midterm 0% final 60%
final grade: A+
